page.title: 04THE TWO VILLAGE SCHOOLS
page.content:
There are two{primary schools}in Eglinton, both run by the{Western {Education and Library Board.}Children attend between the ages of 5 and 11.
1.{Eglinton Controlled Primary School} has 204 pupils on rolls. Although a State school, it is attended mainly by Protestants, but a few Roman Catholic children also attend. Pupils are in mixed-ability classes according to age.There are two P1's and one each of P2-P7. A remedial teacher provides help for children with reading and number difficulties. 2.{Broadbridge Voluntary Maintained {Primary School}is the school attended by the Catholic children of the area. There are 160 children and 6 members of staff.The pupils are arranged in P1,P2/3,P3/4,P5,P6 and P7 classes.
